body: Hi, is it possible to reduce the opacity of the  skydome .i.e make the sky dome translucent so that one can see the building geometry inside ?

replies.body: There is a brep output that you can use for this purpose. Meshes in Grasshopper doesn't accept transparency. Here is an example with older versions. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/FAP00mbKucix3fb4cbV0YhmrQzmAsOLGTLLYz-dIZbAzM3Uln0O5-ASFn7kjwvkBuq866YBrs1GyRrt8tDEIvYjBjWbKp*cd/skyPatchesTransparency.png)

Hi Sarith! Yes. it is possible. You can see it on the Comment wall. [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug?commentId=2985220%3AComm...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1043327&xg_source=activity) And I use the method which is shown in the image below for the Shading Mask. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/FAP00mbKucjc1ImeMQXahmAceRtYKwAawkFPuZ6E5P5uTfDyjsQ4xPHUt98VhwOfe5MjRBbkh1-Fz1WBCbO0wkD3YZT4SGoH/Canvasat234801.png) Bests Antonello
I searched for it on the messageboard but I think I was using the wrong search words. Both the solutions are helpful. Thank you !
